question:
In context of the recent plans to introduce partial tax relief in Mumbai for the prime taxpayers, consider the following statements:
  1. After receiving the demand order from the IT department’s assessing officer, the tax payer can pay 20% of the demand in installments.
  2. The 20% payment of demand is waived off for deserving tax payers under the new scheme.
Which of the above statements is/are true?
explanation: Statement 1 is correct: The Income tax department has introduced an instalment mechanism for businesses and companies- which are the prime tax payers in Mumbai. Under this mechanism, the deserving tax payer can pay the 20% of the demand from the assessing officer in instalments as opposed to the lump payment within a month rule that is currently followed. Statement 2 is incorrect: The new norms will not waive off any tax liability and does not affect the department’s revenue collection. It only gives a partial tax relief on a case to case basis. The deserving tax payer has till end of March to finish the payment. The move was made in light of the liquidity crisis.
